meanings.definition: To collect and combine (information, data, etc.) in a proper order or sequence.
meanings.sent1: I will collate all the research papers before writing my report.
meanings.sent2: The librarian needs to collate the books on the shelf by genre.
meanings.sent3: It was like a puzzle trying to collate all the scattered pieces of information.
meanings.sent4: She had to collate her thoughts before making an important decision.
meanings.sent5: Collating the evidence made the case much clearer.

meanings.definition: To compare (texts, information, etc.) in order to note points of agreement or disagreement.
meanings.sent1: Let's collate the two reports to see if they match.
meanings.sent2: The students were asked to collate their findings and present them in class.
meanings.sent3: Collating the different opinions was both enlightening and confusing.
meanings.sent4: She had to collate the feedback from various sources to draw conclusions.
meanings.sent5: Collating the data revealed interesting patterns.
